Please dont call it a movie when it is homemade from a few episodes.
Nothing to do with a movie, even the quality is fine.
Has no ending.
Like serving a cool drink, without having a chance to taste the drink.
You should call it what it is.
Also you are in debt for serving the ending.
Otherwise you shouldn't start it.
Just my opinion.

Dude, this rocks! Great initiative and well executed - clearly aimed at the diehard-Lost-fans (like me). To experience the story linear is very interesting and you've done a great job. Naturally, it helps if you've seen the real series (seasons 1-3) to add some context, but having it edited like this is superb. Very well done and tremendous work! Here's nothing new in addition to what's been seen, but the editing puts the story in a linear fashion with many advantages: to experience the crash simoltaneusly through Desmonds, the passengers and the island people ("the others") adds a lot. I think norsee (who did this) doesn't confuse anyone with the origin of this, everything is clearly stated and the usual complainers can go elsewhere. Qualitywise ok, even if the format changes sometimes (very few). Like I said, terrific stuff!

zorpry: It's a project, not a movie. If Lost should be made as a movie instead of a serie, then they would have to introduce the story more chronologicaly.

My attempt is to give you an idea of how that would look, but to make a real movie like the movies you know is quite awkward since I don't have access to video cameras, original location and Lost actors.

Anyway: I'ld like to say thank you those of you who liked this thing...

I think most of us understand that perfectly, norsee. And you've given it a hell of a shot! Like I said, to experience the story linear when the plane is about to crash - seen from both Desmond's, the passengers and the others point of view - that's a knock-out. Really appreciate your efforts, keep them coming!
Do you have a deadline, when the next one should be finished?
